headline.main: Nigeria Hopes Rescued Women Can Offer Clues to Missing Girls
headline.print_headline: Nigeria Hopes Rescued Women Can Offer Clues to Missing Girls

docs.snippet: Nigeria's military said on Wednesday it had transported nearly 300 women and girls rescued from Boko Haram to the hilly border town of Gwoza, as it seeks clues to the whereabouts of other girls whose abduction last year provoked international outr...
docs.lead_paragraph: Nigeria's military said on Wednesday it had transported nearly 300 women and girls rescued from Boko Haram to the hilly border town of Gwoza, as it seeks clues to the whereabouts of other girls whose abduction last year provoked international outrage.

headline.main: U.S., Marshall Islands Discuss Way Ahead After Iran Detains Ship
headline.print_headline: U.S., Marshall Islands Discuss Way Ahead After Iran Detains Ship

docs.snippet: Officials from the United States and the Marshall Islands are discussing "the way ahead" after Iranian patrol boats forcibly diverted a cargo ship flying a Marshall Islands flag into an anchorage in Iranian waters, the Pentagon said on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Officials from the United States and the Marshall Islands are discussing "the way ahead" after Iranian patrol boats forcibly diverted a cargo ship flying a Marshall Islands flag into an anchorage in Iranian waters, the Pentagon said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Republican Budget Seeks to Boost Defense Spending, Ease Repeal of Obamacare
headline.print_headline: Republican Budget Seeks to Boost Defense Spending, Ease Repeal of Obamacare

docs.snippet: Republicans unveiled the first joint House-Senate budget plan in six years on Wednesday, aiming to boost defense spending, eliminate deficits by 2024 and ease a repeal of  President Barack Obama's signature health care reform law....
docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans unveiled the first joint House-Senate budget plan in six years on Wednesday, aiming to boost defense spending, eliminate deficits by 2024 and ease a repeal of  President Barack Obama's signature health care reform law.

headline.main: Charlie Hebdo Cartoonist Says He Will No Longer Draw Prophet
headline.print_headline: Charlie Hebdo Cartoonist Says He Will No Longer Draw Prophet

docs.snippet: The French cartoonist Luz, who drew Charlie Hebdo's cover picture of the Prophet Mohammad after the Islamist killings at the satirical weekly in January, has said he will no longer draw the Prophet....
docs.lead_paragraph: The French cartoonist Luz, who drew Charlie Hebdo's cover picture of the Prophet Mohammad after the Islamist killings at the satirical weekly in January, has said he will no longer draw the Prophet.
